name: Pipsqueak (iron_lemon)
description:
pip2 - /pip/

noun: pip; plural noun: pips

  1. any of the spots on playing cards, dice, or dominoes.

Rodent #B0240 looks like a promising candidate for testing. Seems like an abnormal brain to body mass ratio, lets see how badly he wants his cheese...

Pipsqueak is a short puzzle game with a pleasant cheese motif and a shortage of pixels. The controls are simple, WASD control the direction in which your cheese-die will roll, and the number on top will dictate how many tiles you travel. Each level can be restarted with R at any time,  M toggles the soundtrack. Double tap Escape to give up early.

You must land on the goal square in each level, but more importantly, you must have the correct number on your die facing upwards! To help you track the orientation of your dairy prism, helpful numbers in the top right will indicate the number of pips for one side on each of the x, y, and z axes.

* Remember that opposing faces always add up to 7 on a regular die, mice dice are no exception!*

It might not be fun, but it is free AND it only took half a weekend.

And I didn't remember to submit to the game jam.
